image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Jamie Chalker standing at a lectern and looking up and to the side with a serious expression.

items.synopsis: Jamie Chalker retired from his position as the Northern Territory's top cop this weekend, six months before his contract was due to expire. It came after weeks of¬†uncertainty about his employment future.

title.children: The NT police commissioner has retired after reaching a settlement with the government. How did we get here?

image.altText: A Northern Territory Police car.

items.synopsis: Police allege¬†the two cars were stolen, before being used in two ram raids and another business break-in.¬†

title.children: Pair arrested after cars stolen, allegedly used to ram raid two Darwin businesses

image.altText: A man stands against the window

items.synopsis: After a stroke in 2021,¬†Richard Crookes¬†travels to Adelaide every eight weeks for rehabilitation because he can‚Äôt get the treatment he needs in the Northern Territory.

title.children: Richard used to wrangle crocodiles in the Top End. Now he struggles to make a cup of tea

image.altText: Head shot of MasterChef Jock Zonfrillo, who is standing in front of a large pile of chefs' aprons.

items.synopsis: Born in Glasgow, Zonfrillo operated renowned restaurants in Sydney and Adelaide over two decades before becoming a judge on MasterChef in 2019.

title.children: Jock Zonfrillo, celebrated chef and judge on MasterChef Australia, dies aged 46

image.altText: Jock takes a selfie with the other judges.

items.synopsis: The MasterChef community has been rocked by the sudden death of judge Jock Zonfrillo, who is being remembered for his ‚Äúcharisma, wicked sense of humour, generosity and passion‚Äù.

title.children: MasterChef judge Jock Zonfrillo remembered for 'wicked sense of humour'

schema.headline: Live updates: MasterChef judge Jock Zonfrillo dies, aged 46

liveBlogUpdate.headline: 'Keep this proud Scot in your heart': Zonfrillo's family share tribute
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Jock Zonfrillo's famly have shared the below message on his Facebook page. "With completely shattered hearts and without knowing how we can possibly move through life without him, we are devastated to share that Jock passed away yesterday. "So many words can describe him, so many stories can be told, but at this time we're too overwhelmed to put them into words. "For those who crossed his path, became his mate, or were lucky enough to be his family, keep this proud Scot in your hearts when you have your next whisky. "We implore you to please let us grieve privately as we find a way to nagivate through this, and find space on the other side to celebrate our irreplaceable husband, father, brother, son and friend."

liveBlogUpdate.headline: 'He brought a smile to my face each time I watched him'
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Absolutely devastated to hear of this so sad and tragic news. Australia is poorer for the enormous loss of his kindness and generosity of spirit. My heart goes out to his beloved family. - Lisa This is just so sudden and extremely sad. Wondering whether filming for the season would even have finished yet? I imagine the cast and crew would be absolutely devastated. - Amesy What a great man. He bought a smile to my face each time I watched him with his compassion and humility and humour. RIP - Tony Matheson RIP Jock üôèüèªüôèüèª - Elizabeth Dennison

liveBlogUpdate.headline: MasterChef 'will never be the same without' Jock
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I can't believe what I have just read. I don't want to believe that Jock Zonfrillo is gone.. A remarkable man such a talented individual. Gone way to soon. RIP JOCK ZONFRILLO - Sandra So sorry to hear that our favourite Judge has passed. RIP - J Tamblyn I am so deeply stunned and saddened by the news of Jock's passing. I have loved watching him over his career as a MasterChef judge and it will never be the same without him. RIP Jock and my deepest condolences to his family. - Jacqui

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Zonfrillo's formative years 'heavily influenced by two strong cultures'
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: I wanted to go back to the statement MasterChef released as they charted Jock's career beautifully. Determined and talented and with plenty of grit, Jock was born in Glasgow to an Italian father and a Scottish mother, which meant his formative years were heavily influenced by two strong cultures and it was his obsession with food and desire for a new pushbike that at just 12 years old fuelled Jock to knock on kitchen doors looking for a job. Jock‚Äôs love and passion for food saw him become one of the youngest culinary students to do an apprenticeship at The Turnberry Hotel at just 15 years of age. From that point onwards there was no holding him back and by 17 he was working alongside Marco Pierre White at his eponymous Restaurant Macro Pierre White. Throughout his career he worked with world famous chefs and in restaurants all over the world. His talent saw him shine in the world‚Äôs most formidable kitchens and he opened Bistro Blackwood and Restaurant Orana in Adelaide after moving to Australia. Jock‚Äôs Restaurant Orana was recognised with the coveted distinction of three hats in both 2019 and 2020 and he also received global accolades, accepting the prestigious Basque Culinary World Prize in 2018. In 2019, Jock was named as a judge on MasterChef Australia in which he took great pride in challenging and coaching the contestants and of course inspiring a nation of home cooks.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Fans react to Jock Zonfrillo's death
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Lots of you are writing in. Here's a handful of your thoughts. Deeply saddened to hear this news. RIP Jock. - Gwenda Moss This is a shock!! Deepest condolences to all the family and close friends. - Vincent Very sad news üòû Thoughts and love to Jock's family and friends. - Natty

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Jamie Oliver shared photo with Jock Zonfrillo
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Just 4 hours ago chef Jamie Oliver shared this snap with Jock Zonfrillo, Andy Allen and Melissa Leong which was taken a while ago during filming. "So excited for you all to see the first episode of Masterchef Australia! Aussie friends, its on TONIGHT at 7:30pm," Oliver wrote at the time. MasterChef's series return has seen been postponed.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: The return of MasterChef has been postponed
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: MasterChef Australia, now in its 15th season was due to return tonight. But the series return has been pushed back, with the show writing online: "MasterChef Australia will not air this week."

liveBlogUpdate.headline: MasterChef family 'deeply shocked'
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: In a statement Channel 10 confirmed Jock Zonfrillo died in Melbourne yesterday, saying the network was ‚Äúdeeply shocked and saddened at the sudden loss‚Äù. "Jock was known to Australians as a chef, best-selling author, philanthropist and MasterChef judge but he will be best remembered as a loving father, husband, brother and son. "Jock‚Äôs charisma, wicked sense of humour, generosity, passion and love for food and his family cannot be measured. He will be greatly missed."

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Jock Zonfrillo dies aged 46
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Masterchef Australia judge Jock Zonfrillo has died aged 46. Zonfrillo died in Melbourne on Sunday, a Facebook post from MasterChef Australia confirmed on Monday afternoon. Follow our live blog as we bring you the latest updates.

liveBlogStreamPrepared.name: Live updates: MasterChef judge Jock Zonfrillo dies, aged 46

image.altText: a young woman walking outdoors after leaving a court house

items.synopsis: The daughter of a former deputy commissioner at¬†the Australian Tax Office is sentenced to a maximum of eight years in prison for her role in a $105 million tax fraud conspiracy.

title.children: Lauren Cranston jailed for eight years over one of Australia's biggest tax frauds

image.altText: Colourful helium balloons with streamers attached floating under a ceiling

items.synopsis: Since 2010, a by-product from a Darwin LNG plant has been Australia's only helium source. But with the feedstock for the gas plant due to run out in the coming months,¬†we're about to begin importing it all.

title.children: Helium production in Australia is about to end. Could another source fill the gap?

image.altText: Abbott gestures with a grin as he sits on a committee bench inside parliament.

items.synopsis: Former prime minister Tony Abbott has offered a staunch criticism of a¬†proposed constitutionally enshrined Voice to Parliament, just hours after getting into a spat with a parliamentary committee investigating the looming referendum.

title.children: Tony Abbott mounts attack on Voice after a spat with parliamentary committee

image.altText: A group of four people standing in front of saluting paramedics, clearly overwhelmed with emotion.

items.synopsis: Steven Tougher's expecting wife was among those who paid tribute to the 29-year-old at an emotional service in Wollongong.

title.children: 'They will forever know their dad was a hero': 1,000 mourners farewell slain NSW paramedic

image.altText: Glass on ground with Maryborough town sign in background

items.synopsis: One of the victims of a horror triple-fatal crash in Maryborough, allegedly involving a stolen vehicle, was a nurse who had just finished her shift at the local hospital. Her colleagues were among the first responders.¬†

title.children: Nurse driving home from shift among victims of triple-fatal crash involving allegedly stolen car

image.altText: A composite image of Marion Scrymgour, Lidia Thorpe and Jacinta Nampijinpa Price

items.synopsis: The 2022 federal election delivered record results for First Nations¬†representation in parliament. Ahead of the referendum, the ABC contacted the 11 politicians to hear directly from them what they think about a constitutionally enshrined Voice to Parliament.

title.children: There are 11 First Nations MPs and senators. Here's what they think of a Voice to Parliament

image.altText: a man with blood coming from his mouth after being hit

items.synopsis: The man accused of punching and kicking a soccer referee in the head after a Friday night match in Sydney is refused bail.

title.children: Soccer spectator accused of punching out teeth of referee in 'outrageous attack' refused bail

image.altText: A submarine moves through the water towards the camera, in the day time. The shoreline can be seen in the distance.

items.synopsis: Until Australia's submarine fleet can go nuclear the navy must keep its near-retirement vessels deployable. It's been a struggle.

title.children: How Australia was left with only one deployable submarine

image.altText: a man and a car with bullet holes

items.synopsis: Morning raids lead to the arrest of two men as investigations into the alleged underworld hit continue.

title.children: Police investigating gangland shooting allegedly uncover separate murder plot

image.altText: A sepia-tone image of Broderick Smith as a young man, with 70s shoulder-length hair and a steady gaze.

items.synopsis: Broderick Smith dies peacefully at home aged 75 after a career playing blues, boogie, country and rock across Australia and the world.

title.children: Pioneering Australian musician and The Dingoes frontman Broderick Smith dies aged 75

image.altText: Steven Hocking and Gillon McLachlan sit in front of Andrew Dillon at an AFL ground.

items.synopsis: The AFL has named Andrew Dillon its next chief executive, taking over from Gillon McLachlan, who announced his upcoming resignation almost a year ago.

title.children: 'I don't buy that one bit': Next AFL CEO denies claims of a boys' club after promotion from general counsel

image.altText: Heather Mitchell stands with two drinks in her hand in a room lit by a table lamp

items.synopsis: Actor Heather Mitchell's life has been as dramatic off screen as it has on. And she‚Äôs channelling those experiences into some of the greatest performances of her career.¬†

title.children: How Heather Mitchell survived a 'testosterone, cocaine and alcohol-fuelled' workplace

image.altText: A worker smooths concrete at slab pour at building construction site at Radar Street at Lytton at Brisbane.

items.synopsis: Hundreds of infrastructure projects promised by the former federal government are not properly funded¬†and may be cancelled if a major review¬†deems they cannot be delivered.

title.children: Hundreds of 'completely underfunded' Coalition-era infrastructure projects on the chopping block

image.altText: King Charles walks past a line of men holding their swords upwards. He is wearing a royal uniform.

items.synopsis: The Archbishop of Canterbury has asked members of the public to pledge their allegiance to King Charles III during his coronation on Saturday. Here's what that will look like.

title.children: The public will be asked to pledge allegiance to King Charles III. This is what you need to know

image.altText: A regional express airplane

items.synopsis: Thousands of people living in remote and regional Australia are feeling even more isolated as Rex Airlines reduces some of its flights¬†from today.

title.children: Regions call for 'certainty' as Rex Airlines reduces multiple flight routes

image.altText: An apartment block with large blackened area from fire caused by a missile attack and a crane hovering above

items.synopsis: Driving around Ukraine for the past two weeks revealed to me the extent of devastation that Vladimir Putin's war has wrought upon this country so rich in history, culture and potential, writes John Lyons in Kyiv.

title.children: Putin won't give up on Ukraine, but its people are filled with a deep, burning anger and won't surrender

image.altText: Karl Lagerfeld standing in front of a technological backdrop, wearing a black suit, dark sunglasses and fingerless gloves

items.synopsis: This year's Met Gala¬†is all about the late fashion designer Karl Lagerfeld. Given his past comments about women's bodies, the #MeToo movement and the¬†Syrian refugee crisis, the theme has¬†not been without critics.¬†

title.children: Why is the Karl Lagerfeld theme for the Met Gala so controversial?

image.altText: Man wearing sunnies and baseball cap holding a fish.

items.synopsis: Kevin Darmody ‚Äî described by friends as a friendly¬†bloke who loved¬†a "good yarn" ‚Äî¬†was fishing¬†by¬†the¬†Kennedy River¬†north-west of Cairns when he disappeared from the bank.

title.children: Search continues for well-known publican feared taken by croc in Queensland's far north

image.altText: Brown speckled freshwater crododile sits alongside cram colorbond fence.

items.synopsis: A metre-long female crocodile, believed to be an escaped or dumped pet, was found¬†jammed against a fence¬†by Umina home owners while doing some yard work on Sunday.

title.children: Metre-long croc found in backyard of NSW Central Coast home

image.altText: An African lady smiling in her new social housing residence

items.synopsis: The Parliamentary Budget Office¬†warns phasing out property tax breaks¬†may "trigger a significant economic shock". That's why next week's budget is more focused on increasing the supply of housing rather than trying to make housing affordable by reducing house prices.

title.children: Phasing out property tax breaks could save $74b but it also could create 'significant economic shock'

image.altText: An animation of Earth being orbited by hundreds of objects.

items.synopsis: For millennia¬†humans have gazed up at the wonder of the night sky, but what we can see is rapidly changing because of our quest to be connected.

title.children: Earth's orbit is becoming more crowded and our window to the universe is at stake

image.altText: a man walking next to an election poster of himself

items.synopsis: The Sydney MP makes formal complaints to police and¬†the NSW anti-discrimination board and says he will launch defamation proceedings unless Mr Latham apologises.

title.children: Alex Greenwich takes legal action against Mark Latham over 'homophobic' tweet
